content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>USDA-FSA-APFO Aerial Photography Field Office</origin> <pubdate>20140730</pubdate> <title>NAIP 2014 Imagery Feedback</title> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Salt Lake City, Utah</pubplace> <publish>USDA-FSA-APFO Aerial Photography Field Office</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>http://www.arcgis.com/home/webmap/viewer.html?webmap=590e2b716d3d44c8b6381891f765622b</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract> The NAIP 2014 Imagery Feedback map allows users to make comments and observations about the quality of the 2014 National Agriculture Imagery Program (NAIP) acquisition.  The feedback obtained from this map will be reviewed by APFO staff and considered both for the current year imagery and future updates.  The feedback provided by users will help to improve the NAIP imagery program.  To provide feedback, Click the "Edit" button on the toolbar, then click the open (green) point or polygon symbol in the editing template on the left side of the map. Then click on the imagery at the location of your observation/feature. To add only a comment click the blue map tack symbol and type in your comment. You may also add attachments to your comments or observations.  Click the browse button in the attachments section of the editing pop up window and then choose the file from your computer. The file may be up to 10MB in size and file types include:  DOC, DOCX, GIF, IMG, JP2, JPEG, PDF, TXT, XML, and ZIP. </abstract> <purpose>To provide a public map to gain feedback from NAIP imagery users to improve the program.</purpose> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>2014</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>Current as of 07-30-2014</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>In work</progress> <update>Annually</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-127.56</westbc> <eastbc>-62.65</eastbc> <northbc>51.31</northbc> <southbc>23.55</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>farming</themekey> <themekey>NAIP</themekey> <themekey>FSA</themekey> <themekey>Imagery</themekey> <themekey>Web Map</themekey> <themekey>Aerial Photography</themekey> <themekey>APFO</themekey> <themekey>ArcGIS Online</themekey> <themekey>USDA</themekey> <themekey>Feedback</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>Geographic Names Information System</placekt> <placekey>"United States"</placekey> <placekey>US</placekey> <placekey>North America</placekey> <placekey>State</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst> The map is for illustrative purposes only.  It is not suitable for surveying or engineering purposes, The Aerial Photography Field Office asks to be credited for derived products. </useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>USDA-FSA-APFO feature layer, digital image service, digital base map tiled service</typesrc> <srctime> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>2014</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <srccurr>APFO public image server - current NAIP image services, ESRI World Topo base map - latest edition, APFO ArcGIS Online hosted feature services - latest edition</srccurr> </srctime> <srccitea>N/A</srccitea> <srccontr>Aerial Photography Field Office NAIP Public Image Services layer, Aerial Photography Field Office ArcGIS Online hosted feature services, ESRI World Topographic base map available on ArcGIS Online.</srccontr> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>This ArcGIS Online map was created by first creating a file geodatabase in ArcGIS Desktop 10.2 and then creating a point and polygon feature class which included domains for question categories.  This allows the domains to be transferred to the ArcGIS Online application.  The feature classes were then published as hosted feature services to ArcGIS Online from the ArcGIS desktop software.  The APFO image services were then added into the map using the ESRI world topographic map as the base map.</procdesc> <procdate>20143007</procdate> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <indspref>"US"</indspref> <direct>Vector</direct> <rastinfo> <rasttype>Pixel</rasttype> </rastinfo> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <planar> <mapproj> <mapprojn>WGS 84 Web Mercator Auxiliary Sphere</mapprojn> <mapprojp></mapprojp> </mapproj> <planci> <plance>coordinate pair</plance> <coordrep> <absres>0.1</absres> <ordres>0.1</ordres> </coordrep> <plandu>meters</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>WGS 84</horizdn> <ellips>WGS 1984</ellips> <semiaxis>6378137</semiaxis> <denflat>298.257</denflat> </geodetic> </horizsys> </spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover> The map layer Click Edit to add Points contains the following fields and attributes -  Your Organization - which includes the Organization domain - FSA County Office, FSA State GIS Office, APFO, USDA, USFS, DOI, NRCS, Education, Public, Other Federal Agency, Other. Imagery Usage - which includes the Usage domain - Cartographic, Compliance, Conservation Practices/Programs, Disaster Response, Farm Programs, GIS, Image Analysis, Land Classification, Real Estate/Land Sales, Recreation (e.g. Biking, Hiking, Camping), Spatial Analysis, Research, Other. Observation - which includes the Observations domain - Artifacts, Clouds, Clarity, Haze, Horizontal Accuracy Not Adequate, Imagery works well for my needs, Imagery matches vector layers, Imagery does not match vector layers, Imagery does not match CLU, Missing imagery, Need higher resolution, Offsets of features (e.g. Roads, Streams), Overall appearance of imagery is acceptable, Smearing, Specular reflectance, Tone and color are unacceptable, Other. Comments - Free text field. Status -  which includes the Status domain - New comment, Under review, Fixed, Closed, Reported to data provider, No change planned, Consider for future update. Status Display - Open, Closed Email - Free text field.  The map layer Click Edit to add Polygons contains the following fields and attributes -  Your Organization - which includes the Organization domain - FSA County Office, FSA State GIS Office, APFO, USDA, USFS, DOI, NRCS, Education, Public, Other Federal Agency, Other. Imagery Usage - which includes the Usage domain - Cartographic, Compliance, Farm Programs, GIS, Image Analysis, Spatial Analysis, Research, Other. Observation - which includes the Observations domain - Artifacts, Clouds, Clarity, Haze, Horizontal Accuracy Not Adequate, Imagery works well for my needs, Imagery matches vector layers, Imagery does not match vector layers, Imagery does not match CLU, Missing imagery, Need higher resolution, Offsets of features (e.g. Roads, Streams), Overall appearance of imagery is acceptable, Smearing, Specular reflectance, Tone and color are unacceptable, Other. Comments - Free text field. Status -  which includes the Status domain - New comment, Under review, Fixed, Closed, Reported to data provider, No change planned, Consider for future update. Status Display - Open, Closed Email - Free text field.  The map layer Click Edit to add Comments contains the following fields and attributes -  Comments - Free text field. Recommendations - Free text field  The map layer NAIP 2014 contains the following fields and attributes -  OBJECTID - unique identifier. STATE_NAME. STATE_FIPS STATE_ABBR Vendor - who flew the imagery DOQQs - how many images for the state area SQ_Miles Seasons - Number of flying seasons for a project (state) area Flying_Sta - Flying season start date Flying_End - Flying season end date Early_Acce - Early access web service vendor/provider Imagery - Spacial resolution, spectral resolution, and whether coverage is complete  The map layers:  NAIP Public Image Services contains the following fields and attributes -  OBJECTID - Unique Identifier. Name - Image file name. Category - Type of dataset 1 indicates primary base data. Year_ts - Image year. ST - State postal abbreviation. QQNAME - Quarter Quad name. QQDATE - The date of the Quarter Quad. iDate_ts - Catalog date. </eaover> <eadetcit>The attribute values were derived from information from the APFO public image services and APFO VGI feature classes.</eadetcit> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>APFO GSB</cntper> <cntorg>USDA-FSA-APFO Aerial Photography Field Office</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>2222 West 2300 South</address> <city>Salt Lake City</city> <state>Utah</state> <postal>84119-2020</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>801-844-2900</cntvoice> <cntemail>joan.biediger@slc.usda.gov</cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>ArcGIS Online Web Map</resdesc> <distliab> In no event shall the creators, custodians, or distributors of this information be liable for any damages arising out of its use (or the inability to use it). </distliab> <stdorder> <digform> <digtinfo> <formname>ArcGIS Online Web Map, Digital Vectors ArcGIS Online hosted map service, ESRI ArcGIS Tiled Base Map Service</formname> <formcont>N/A</formcont> </digtinfo> <digtopt> <onlinopt> <computer> <networka> <networkr>http://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=590e2b716d3d44c8b6381891f765622b</networkr> </networka> </computer> </onlinopt> <offoptn> <offmedia>N/A</offmedia> <recfmt>N/A</recfmt> </offoptn> </digtopt> </digform> <fees>N/A</fees> </stdorder> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20140731</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>USDA-FSA-APFO Aerial Photography Field Office</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>2222 West 2300 South</address> <city>Salt Lake City</city> <state>Utah</state> <postal>84119-2020</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>801-844-2900</cntvoice> <cntemail>joan.biediger@slc.usda.gov</cntemail> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn> <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv> </metainfo> </metadata>
